intro: Oreopanax hypargyreus, commonly known as the golden-veined arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with prominent yellow veins. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that are typically enclosed in a spadix, a common feature among members of its family. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine and as a source of starch. Oreopanax hypargyreus thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
